page.title: 05TRANSPORT. LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: { 1877 WAS AN EVENTFUL YEAR FOR GT. HARWOOD.IT WAS THE YEAR THAT THE LOOP LINE FROM BLACKBURN TO GT. HARWOOD,PADIHAM AND ROSE GROVE WAS OPENED.AT THE OPENING A REPORTER SAID,"THERE IS A GREAT NEED FOR THE LINE,ESPECIALLY WITH THE MANUFACTURERS IN PADIHAM AND THE GROWING POPULATION".THE ONLY WAY TO TAKE GOODS OUT OF TOWN BEFORE THE OPENING WAS BY HORSE AND CART OR BY LORRY.THE NEAREST RAILWAY WAS AT RISHTON AND WAS OPENED IN 1848. THE RAILWAY WAS A GREAT ADDITION TO GT.HARWOOD.THE RAILWAY WAS CLOSED IN 1957 AND NOW THE STATION HAS GONE AND MANY OF THE CUTTINGS HAVE BEEN FILLED IN.
